instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1708  820-00840-A NO DISPLAY
threads.message:
HI,
I have a A1708 mac...part no is 820-00840--A
in my c type reader its take 0.465 ma
all coil voltages are active...but 
PPVCCGT_S0G_PH3
missing (there is no voltages on L7410,L7420,L7430)

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]ALL_SYS_PWRGD[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
 
Get 3.2 v

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
 
 get 0v

[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]PM_PCH_PWROK[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
 
get 3.12v

Then i trace 
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK

this is the pwrgood of U7700..there is no voltage on 20th pin of U7700....


[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD]PP1V_OPC_S0[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]
 
I get 1 v

WHAT NEXT...?
[/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

threads.title: A1708  820-00840-A NO DISPLAY
threads.message:
"PPVCCGT_S0G_PH3
missing"
iGPU core voltage will not appear, until high graphics load is detected.

What is CPU core voltage (L7210/20)?

threads.title: A1708  820-00840-A NO DISPLAY
threads.message:
Stuck on 0.96V?
Check it after 10-15s.

PM_PGOOD_CPUVCC comes high?

threads.title: A1708  820-00840-A NO DISPLAY
threads.message:
yes stuck on 0.96 v
PM_PGOOD_CPUVCC gets 3.3v

threads.title: A1708  820-00840-A NO DISPLAY
threads.message:
Check if U7800 (1 OF 10) gets all signals from left side (pag 60).
Also check PM_PGOOD signals listed bellow that area.
